creator: dvandegrift@bluearc.com
text:
I want Chainsaw to hide all rows that have an NDC value.
The following rules seem logical enough but are considered invalid:

   !(NDC EXISTS)
   NDC == ''

Using Chainsaw v2.0 alpha.

creator: sdeboy@iname.com
text:
Parens, operators and operands require spaces.  I just tried something similar
using properties in the tutorial:

! ( prop.hostname exists ) 

Displays zero entries

! ( prop.Xhostname exists )

Displays all entries because there is no Xhostname property

Try this expression:

! ( NDC exists )

The suggested expression works:  ! ( NDC exists )  
The spaces were the key.

Please feel free to mark this bug as INVALID.
Or use it as a reminder to clarify this requirement in Chainsaw's documentation.

Thanks.
creator: dvandegrift@bluearc.com

text:
Thanks..

The spaces issue is described in the tutorial, but the tutorial does need a lot

  All operators, operands and parentheses must be separated by spaces
